meanings.definition: (adjective) pleasantly firm and making a sharp sound when bitten or crushed
meanings.sent1: The apple was the crispest fruit in the basket.
meanings.sent2: She loved the crispest potato chips for their crunch.
meanings.sent3: The crispest crackers made the loudest noise when she bit into them.
meanings.sent4: His shirt was as crispest as freshly fallen snow.
meanings.sent5: The crispest lettuce in the salad added a delightful texture.

meanings.definition: (verb) to make something firm and sharp in texture
meanings.sent1: She crisped the bacon until it was the crispest she had ever tasted.
meanings.sent2: The chef knew how to crisp the edges of the pastry just right.
meanings.sent3: He tried to crisp the toast, but it ended up burnt instead.
meanings.sent4: The sun crisped the leaves on the trees, turning them golden.
meanings.sent5: The wind crisped the pages of the book as she turned them.

meanings.definition: (noun) the state of being firm and sharp in texture
meanings.sent1: The crispest of the vegetables in the salad was the bell pepper.
meanings.sent2: She appreciated the crispest of the autumn air on her morning walk.
meanings.sent3: The crispest of the chips stood out among the snacks at the party.
meanings.sent4: The crispest of the morning light filtered through the window.
meanings.sent5: The crispest of the ice cubes made her drink extra refreshing.
